H0.text: On which Saint's Day in 1572 did a massacre of Huguenots take place. Saint Valentine's Day

H1.text: On which Saint's Day in 1572 did a massacre of Huguenots take place. Saint George's Day

H2.text: On which Saint's Day in 1572 did a massacre of Huguenots take place. Saint Patrick's Day

H3.text: On which Saint's Day in 1572 did a massacre of Huguenots take place. Bartalmai

A4.text: The massacre began in the night of 23–24 August 1572, the eve of the Feast of Saint Bartholomew the Apostle.

A5.text: St Bartholomew'sDay Massacre, BBC Radio 4 discussion with Diarmaid McCulloch, Mark Greengrass & Penny Roberts, chaired by Melvyn Bragg (In Our Time, 27 November 2003)

A6.text: The Saint Bartholomew's Day Massacre, a foundational event (at Massacres.org)

A7.text: In the current Roman General Calendar Saint Bartholomew's feast occurs on 24 August.

A8.text: The feast day of the Apostle is solemnly celebrated there on 24 August by the Christian laity and the Church officials alike.

A9.text: The St. Bartholomew's Day massacre lasted from 24 August to 3 October 1572.

A10.text: In what became known as the St. Bartholomew's Day massacre of 24 August – 3 October 1572, Catholics killed thousands of Huguenots in Paris and similar massacres took place in other towns in the following weeks.
